metadata.subject: Terrorism - Metrojet and Paris Mark Externalization of ISIS Threat

relationships.description: Author of the memo from The Scowcroft Group
ISIS has eclipsed Al Qaeda in operational capability, financing, and recruitment
ISIS military leadership largely drawn from Sunnis who were part of Saddam's military

analysis.purpose: To analyze the changing terrorism threat landscape following recent attacks and predict geopolitical consequences
analysis.significance: Strategic analysis of ISIS capabilities and geopolitical implications following major terrorist attacks in 2015

notable_quotes: ISIS can be expected to undertake further spectacular attacks. It has eclipsed AQ in operational capability, financing, and recruitment. It is not only the wealthiest terror group in history, but one with global reach and ambitions.
The Obama Administration's claims that ISIS is contained now look naive, and that characterization will haunt President Obama and Democrats next year.
The scale of the Paris attacks will energize right-wing politics and pressure center-left governments to make threat reduction a higher priority than humanitarian concerns.

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion present in this analytical memo

illegal_activity.description: Document is an analytical memo about terrorism threats, not involving any illegal activity by the sender

public_knowledge.context: This analysis discusses publicly known terrorist attacks (Metrojet bombing, Paris attacks) and geopolitical analysis that would have been widely covered in media at the time

analysis.summary: This analytical memo from The Scowcroft Group assesses the changing terrorism threat landscape following the 2015 Metrojet bombing and Paris attacks, arguing that ISIS has demonstrated unexpected sophistication and global reach that will lead to increased security measures, political shifts in Europe, and heightened risks to Western targets.
